title: The typeface of brotherly love
content: I'm looking for a typeface that is in some way related to Philadelphia. It could be that the designer was born and raised there, or that it is featured on a Philly landmark, etc. Any ideas?
author: clashmore

comments.content: Benjamin Franklin used a lot of Caslon in Philly.

Philadelphia was home to one of the first successful typefoundries in our young republic. From the Binny & Ronaldson foundry issued the face that is the forerunner of Monticello. Read more here:

[http://press.princeton.edu/Monticello/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131106070733/http:/press.princeton.edu/Monticello/ "http://press.princeton.edu/Monticello/")

\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*  
& wasn't it in his Philadelphia years that Ben Franklin cut Franklin Gothic? Have I got that right?
